abstract: Regulators in Oklahoma have directed energy companies to limit disposal of wastewater from oil and gas extraction in wells across roughly 40-mile stretch of land that has experienced dramatic increase in number of earthquakes since  production boomed in 2010; seismologists attribute quakes to lubricating effect of wastewater, but tremor epidemic is not yet fully understood.
lead_paragraph: A roughly 40-mile-long stretch that includes some 23 wells has experienced a dramatic increase in earthquakes in the last two years.

headline.main: Oklahoma Acts to Limit Earthquake Risk at Oil and Gas Wells
headline.print_headline: Regulators Act to Ease Quake Peril in Oklahoma

snippet: A roughly 40-mile-long stretch that includes some 23 wells has experienced a dramatic increase in earthquakes in the last two years.
